msContents.summary: Giyorgis za-Gāseċċā, Maṣḥafa meśṭir መጽሐፈ ፡ ምሥጢር

msItem.title: Maṣḥafa meśṭir
msItem.note: Introduction, fol. 1r-4r; on the heresy of Sabellius, fol. 4r-10v; on a heresy of Apollinarius, fol. 10v-16v; on the heresy of Arius, fol. 16v-25v; on the heresy of Nestorius, fol. 25v-37r; on the heresy of Photinus, fol. 37v-52r; on a heresy of Origen, fol. 52r-55v; on the heresy of those who say that the Word of God was transformed to be flesh, blood, bone, hair, and tendon, fol. 55v-60r; on the heresy of those who say that the existence of the holy spirit is after the baptism of Christ, fol. 60v-62r; homily on Mary entitled "The white bird with silver wings and a golden torso", fol. 62r-66r; on the heresy of Bitu, fol. 66r-77v; against the Antidicomarianites, fol. 77v-80r; homily of Retu'a Hāymānot to strengthen the faithful in their belief in Jesus Christ, fol. 80r-87r; homily of one of the orthodox of Ethiopia on the footwashing, fol. 87r-91r; on the heresy of Eutyches, fol. 91r-98v; on the heresy of Severos of India and Theodosios of Alexandria, fol. 98v-102v; on another heresy of Apollinarius, fol. 102v-107r; on the heresy of Eutychius, fol. 107r-115v; on the heresy of Mani, fol. 116r-119v; on the heretics who teach that Christ descended to hell in soul and flesh, fol. 120r-133v; on the heresy of Leo, fol. 134r-149r; against the Council of Chalcedon, fol. 149r-153v; against the Phantasiasts, fol. 153v-159v; against those who believe that children receive their souls forty days after birth, fol. 159v-165r; on another heresy of Origen, fol. 165r-173v; against those who do not believe in the transformation of the bread and wine, fol. 173v-184r; homily on the Ten Commandments, fol. 184r-207r; against those who believe that the soul dies with the flesh, fol. 207r-220v; on the heresy of Flavian, fol. 220v-225r; on the heresy of Macedonius, fol. 225r-238v; against those who follow the teaching of the Sadducees, fol. 238v-246r; colophon, fol. 246rv

origin.origDate: 1918 EC = 1925-6 (colophon added at the bottom of f. ca. 2r, and mentions Ḫaylä Śǝllase)

history.provenance: Given to the Church of St. Mark by Emperor Haile Selassie I in 1925-6 A.D.(notes on ff. 2a, 147a and 246b). In the church of St. Mark when filmed.
